entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued September 08 at 4:18AM AKDT until September 08 at 8:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility as low as one quarter mile in dense fog. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula from Sterling to Clam Gulch. * WHEN...Until 8 AM AKDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of dense fog are possible along the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Kenai Peninsula

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 3:56AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...MOOSE GLACIER DAMMED LAKE IS RELEASING AND COULD CAUSE HIGH WATER IN KENAI LAKE AND COOPER LANDING AREA... WHAT: There is reason to believe the Moose Glacier dammed lake (GDP) has begun releasing. WHERE: Biggest impacts at Snow River leading into Kenai Lake and Cooper Landing area.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 2:44PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...CONFIDENCE INCREASING FOR HEAVY RAIN THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT... A front over the eastern Gulf of Alaska will stall on the outer coast this evening. A second front with atmospheric river characteristics will merge with the first and shift west before stalling once again, this time over the northeast Gulf Coast. Heaviest rain totals through Friday night will be located over
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Yakutat; Glacier Bay

entry.cap:areaDesc: Maricopa

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 8:02AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF DENSE FOG AFFECTING PORTIONS OF THE NORTHLAND THIS MORNING... Areas of dense fog were occurring from the Brainerd Lakes east through Cloquet, Moose Lake, the St. Croix River Valley to Siren. Visibilities of 1/2 to 1/4 mile are being been observed. Expect the visibility to improve over the next 1 to 2 hours. overnight
entry.cap:areaDesc: Burnett

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 3:15AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: Elevated to near critical fire weather conditions expected today between 1 PM and 7 PM MDT. Minimum relative humidity values 12 to 16 percent and west to southwest wind gusts 20 to 25 mph are possible. Any fires that develop may spread rapidly. Caution is advised if outdoor burning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: North Snowy Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County
